resources.string: This application requires a working Internet connection. Neither WiFi nor Mobile network is currently available.
Can\'t retrieve the list of available protocol specifications. Perhaps the measurement server is down, try to connect later. Or check the measurement server connection parameters.

To start measurements, please specify the number of tests to run and press the \"Start Measurements\" button. If you are using this application for the first time, it\'s highly recommended to read the \"About\" section (press Menu), especially paragraph 4.
Can\'t start measurements. Wrong number of tests to run has been provided. The correct value should be in range from 3 to 15.
Writing measurement test results onto SD card failed.
Test completed. Measurement results have been stored to \"%s\" local file. You can share your results with us by pressing the \"Upload Results\" button below
Measurement results has been uploaded. Thanks for your cooperation.
Error occur while uploading measurement test results.
Are you sure that you want to delete %s file from SD-card?
You pressed \"Upload file\" button. %s file will be uploaded to our file storage, and collected data will be analyzed. Continue?
Error occur while initializing application context. Reason: SD card is not ready to use.
Please wait until the test is complete...
Error occur while running measurement test. Test skipped.

\tBonaFide Provider is an application that helps you to detect whether your Mobile Network Provider performs traffic differentiation. Your mobile provider might artificially limits a performance of certain type of traffic. For example the bandwidth for VoIP applications might be limited, in order to make using VoIP in mobile networks impossible. This application allows you to run a series of measurement tests to discover whether traffic throttling schemes were applied along the path.

\tBonaFide Provider is a part of a research project of Computer Networks and Distributed Systems(CNDS) research group at Jacobs University Bremen. The main goal of this project is to collect and analyze the data from different mobile operators around the world, in order to learn whether and to which extend traffic shaping schemes are deployed in mobile networks. So, if you want to make a contribution to our research, you can submit your measurement results to us.

\tBonaFide establishes a connection with our measurement server and generates two separate data flows. The first flow sends packets that carry randomly generated data. The second flow has exactly the same characteristics like the first one, but it carries packets that implement protocol that you want to test. The significant difference in those two flows performances might indicate that some traffic shaping policies were applied by a mobile provider along the path.

\tFirst you need to specify the number of tests to execute. The actual channel performance in mobile networks is not a constant value and might change significantly during the time, especially in low-speed networks like EDGE. So, a single test execution will not be enough to make a conclusion about the traffic shaping existence along the path. To tolerate those errors it\'s highly recommended to increase the number of tests to run to 7-10 times. But keep in mind that you\'ll also increase the amount of data being transmitted during the tests. The total amount of data depends on the mobile network type that you are using. For example for the low-speed networks like EDGE one test consumes ~1 MB of data. For more faster network types like HSPA approximately 4MB of data is consumed. The measurement results are stored on SD card inside the BonaFide folder.

\tTest execution result file contains four tables: Download and Upload performances for Random and Protocol flows. Each table represents estimated channel bandwidth in some direction(upload or download) for messages of a different sizes. The bandwidth estimated for the biggest message size corresponds to an actual bandwidth of the link.\n\tNow you can compare corresponding values for Random and Protocol flows. And if the estimated bandwidth for a Protocol flow is always significantly lower than for a Random flow, than your mobile operator does some traffic shaping for a tested protocol type.\n\tN.B. The test result file also provides an information about the signal strength and network state changes during the test execution time. If the signal strength changes from the very low value(0-5 asu) to very high values(25-30) or vice versa, or even worse - the network disconnections were observed, the obtained results can\'t be treated as reliable anymore.
Do you really want to terminate current measurement test?
Error occurred while downloading protocol description file

BonaFide provider supports sharing measurement results across multiple phones. You can collect measurements via multiple phones or transfer your results to your new one. Go to Settings -> Identification token and enter it to another phone.
This URL points to the central server REST interface
The URL you entered is invalid.

Token enables one to anonymously access own results, even from multiple devices. No personal informations are stored beside this token. If you use this application for the first time, let it empty, it will be automatically generated. If you attempt to transfer all measurement results to another device, paste this token into it.
Edit only when transferring results from another device. Change to empty if you want to generate a new token.
Automatic measurement will be started after this time
Time treshold is useful when you stay long time at the same location (e.g. at home, office etc.)
Time treshold must be bigger equal than 5 minutes
Automatic measurement will be started when you move
Movement treshold is useful when you change your location frequently. It helps you to automatically test areas of your movement.
Minimal movement treshold can be 50 meters
Your mobile device is currently not connected to any network.
Measurement server doesn\'t support any protocols
Error while retrieving results from the measurement server
There was an error while interacting with the server. Make sure you are online and repeat the action again.
Loading data from server. Please wait.

Number of cycles has an influence on the traffic, which will be generated. Please consider higher number of cycles only if you have an unlimited data plan! If you set number of cycles to 5, then the measurement will be repeated 5 times.
Measurement with multiple cycles can generate more traffic. Please confirm, that you are aware of it and that you wish to continue.
Searching for location. Location will enable you to view your results on the map.
Location of measurement is available. You will be able to view your result on the map.
Measurement was started. Check notification bar for details.
Access to your location is currently disabled. Location enables you to view your results on the map, so you will be able to analyse results at certain locations.
BonaFide provider is running in background
Loading results from server. Please wait.
There was an error while interacting with the central server. Make sure you are online and repeat the action again.

BonaFide provider is storing measurement results on the central server. The application doesn\'t send any information to the central server, which can identify you. Results are stored without an unique connection to you. Stored informations are identified by the identification token, which is randomly generated when this application stores result for the first time. Your results are only accessible via this identification token, which is only known to you (every user has a different token). It is very difficult to guess this token and even if it would be guessed, there is no information about who you are (telephone number, e-mail address etc.). Stored are measurement results, your mobile provider, country, location of the measurement.\n\nBonaFide project is open source. You can view the source code for details.
